comments.text:
I just had a very strange problem.  Here's approximately what happened

 (1) Nightly from a few weeks ago(?) open, with 3 tabs.  Browser is *NOT* in private browsing mode.
 (2) User (me) fat-fingers Ctrl-Q when he wanted Ctrl-Tab.  (Siiiiiiiiiiiigh.)
 (3) User restarts Nightly.  Nightly updates to some version before latest; not sure exactly which.
 (4) Session is *NOT* restored.  Investigation shows that private browsing mode is on, and can't be turned off (menu item is disabled).
 (5) User frantically updates to latest Nightly (11/16).  Same problem.
 (6) Further investigation shows that |user_pref("browser.privatebrowsing.autostart", true);| somehow got into prefs.js in user's profile.  User definitely did *NOT* add that.

So I'm back on track with a little bit of lost session, but man, this is an annoying problem.  Any ideas?

comments.text:
The key here is,

 User definitely did *NOT* enter private browsing mode.  At any point.

The sequence of events was

 - Not in PB mode
 - Accidental quit
 - Restart *in PB mode*.  User did not request PB mode.
 - Can't exit PB mode except by removing the pref

I don't think this is by design.  I don't think I would ever be able to reproduce this (and I don't have time to try), so RESO->INCOMPLETE or whatever is fine with me.

comments.raw_text:
Can you make sure that they have never activated the "Never remember history" setting in the Privacy pane of the Preferences dialog?  That is implemented with permanent private browsing mode.

Currently that is the only place where we set that pref in our code base.  As far as I know, no add-ons use that pref (but I may be wrong on that.)
